canonical_explanation.text: A community is a group of people who live and work together in a place. People do different types of work called occupations. Farmers grow food, teachers teach in schools, doctors treat sick people, police keep us safe, and postmen deliver letters. People work to earn money, help others, and serve the community. Every type of work is important and we should respect all workers — whether they are doctors, sweepers, drivers, or guards. This is called dignity of labour. India has both villages and cities. Village life is peaceful with farming, open fields, and ponds, while city life has tall buildings, offices, more traffic, and many markets.
rules: People do different types of work called occupations
Every worker is important to the community
People work to earn money, help others, and serve the community
All work is important — no job is big or small (dignity of labour)
Village life and city life are different but both are important

questions.question_text: What is the work of a farmer?
questions.explanation_correct: A farmer grows crops and food. Farmers work in fields and grow rice, wheat, vegetables, and fruits that we eat every day. Without farmers, we would not have food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Teaching is the work of a teacher, treating sick people is the work of a doctor, and delivering letters is the work of a postman. A farmer's work is to grow crops and food in the fields.

questions.question_text: Who uses a stethoscope to check patients?
questions.explanation_correct: A doctor uses a stethoscope to listen to the heartbeat and breathing of patients. The stethoscope is an important tool that helps doctors check if we are healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A teacher uses chalk and books, a farmer uses plough and tools, and a carpenter uses wood and hammer. A doctor uses a stethoscope to check patients' heartbeat and breathing.

questions.question_text: A person who delivers letters and parcels is called a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A postman delivers letters and parcels to our homes. The postman picks up mail from the post office and goes from house to house delivering it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A policeman keeps us safe, a driver drives vehicles, and a tailor stitches clothes. The person who delivers letters and parcels is called a postman.

questions.question_text: Who uses a plough to work in the fields?
questions.explanation_correct: A farmer uses a plough to turn the soil in the fields before planting seeds. The plough breaks up the hard ground and makes it ready for sowing seeds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors use stethoscopes, teachers use chalk and blackboard, and cobblers use thread and needle for shoes. A farmer uses a plough to prepare the soil in the fields.

questions.question_text: Priya's father uses a hammer, nails, and wood to make chairs and tables. What is his occupation?
questions.explanation_correct: Priya's father is a carpenter. A carpenter uses hammer, nails, saw, and wood to make furniture like chairs, tables, doors, and cupboards.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A tailor stitches clothes, a potter makes pots from clay, and a blacksmith works with iron. A person who uses hammer, nails, and wood to make furniture is called a carpenter.

questions.question_text: Ravi's mother uses needles, thread, scissors, and a sewing machine. She is most likely a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Ravi's mother is a tailor. A tailor uses needles, thread, scissors, and a sewing machine to stitch clothes. Tailors make new clothes and also repair old ones.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Teachers use books and chalk, chefs use cooking utensils, and painters use brushes and colours. A person who uses needles, thread, scissors, and a sewing machine is a tailor.

questions.question_text: Match the correct worker with their tool:
questions.explanation_correct: Carpenter — hammer is the correct match. A carpenter uses a hammer along with nails, saw, and wood to make furniture. A doctor uses a stethoscope, a teacher uses chalk, and a farmer uses a plough.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A doctor uses a stethoscope (not a plough), a teacher uses chalk (not a stethoscope), and a farmer uses a plough (not chalk). The only correct match is carpenter — hammer.

questions.question_text: A person who repairs shoes is called a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A person who repairs shoes is called a cobbler. Cobblers use thread, glue, and small tools to fix torn or broken shoes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A carpenter works with wood, a potter makes clay pots, and a barber cuts hair. A cobbler is the person who repairs shoes using thread, glue, and tools.

questions.question_text: Why do people work?

options.text: To earn money and serve the community
They do not have anything else to do

questions.explanation_correct: People work to earn money, help others, and serve the community. Through work, people can buy food, clothes, and other things needed for their families. Their work also helps other people in the community.
questions.explanation_incorrect: People work for important reasons — to earn money for their families and to serve the community. A doctor helps sick people, a farmer grows food for everyone, and a teacher educates children. Work is not just for fun or fame.

questions.question_text: Who are community helpers?

options.text: People who help us in our daily life

questions.explanation_correct: Community helpers are people who help us in our daily life. Doctors, teachers, police, postmen, firefighters, and sanitation workers are all community helpers who make our lives better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Community helpers are not just certain types of people. They are all the people who work to help our community — teachers, doctors, police, postmen, drivers, sweepers, and many more.

questions.question_text: If there were no farmers, what would happen?

options.text: We would have no food to eat

questions.explanation_correct: If there were no farmers, we would have no food to eat. Farmers grow rice, wheat, vegetables, and fruits that feed everyone. They are some of the most important workers in our community.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers grow the food we eat every day. Without farmers, there would be no rice, wheat, vegetables, or fruits. We would have nothing to eat! This shows how important farmers are to our community.

questions.question_text: Anu is sick and goes to the hospital. Her mother drives there. The guard opens the gate, and the doctor checks Anu. How many community helpers helped Anu?
questions.explanation_correct: Two community helpers helped Anu: the guard who opened the gate and the doctor who checked her. Her mother drove her but is a family member, not specifically a community helper in this scenario.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Think about who helped Anu as part of their jobs. The guard opened the gate (helper 1) and the doctor checked Anu (helper 2). Her mother is family, not a community helper in this case. So two community helpers helped.

questions.question_text: Which statement is TRUE about work?

options.text: Only some types of work are useful
Every type of work is important for the community
Only office work is real work
Work done at home is not important

questions.explanation_correct: Every type of work is important for the community. Whether someone is a doctor, teacher, sweeper, driver, or cook — their work helps others and makes the community function well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All types of work are important, not just some. Office work, fieldwork, housework, and manual labour are all valuable. Without sweepers, our streets would be dirty. Without farmers, we would have no food. Every job matters.

questions.question_text: What does 'dignity of labour' mean?

options.text: All work is important and every worker deserves respect
Only doctors and teachers should be respected

questions.explanation_correct: Dignity of labour means that all work is important and every worker deserves respect. No job is big or small. A sweeper's work is as important as a doctor's work because both serve the community.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dignity of labour does not mean only some jobs deserve respect. It means EVERY type of work and EVERY worker deserves respect. Whether someone sweeps the streets or runs a hospital, their work has dignity and value.

questions.question_text: We should respect _____.

options.text: Only people who wear nice clothes
All workers, no matter what job they do
Only people who earn lots of money

questions.explanation_correct: We should respect all workers, no matter what job they do. Every person who works hard deserves respect. A sweeper, guard, driver, or cook is as important as any other worker.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Respect should not depend on what clothes someone wears or how much money they earn. Every worker — whether a sweeper, driver, farmer, or doctor — works hard and deserves equal respect.

questions.question_text: In Raj's school, some children make fun of the school helper who cleans the classrooms. Is this right?

options.text: Yes, because cleaning is not important
No, we should respect all workers and their work
Yes, because children can do anything

questions.explanation_correct: No, it is not right. We should respect all workers. The school helper keeps the classroom clean so children can study in a healthy environment. Without their work, the school would be dirty and unhealthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Making fun of any worker is wrong. The school helper does very important work — keeping classrooms clean so students can study. Every worker deserves respect, and making fun of someone's work hurts their feelings.

questions.question_text: Anita says, 'My mother is just a homemaker, she does not work.' Is Anita correct?

options.text: Yes, homemakers do not do any work
No, homemakers do a lot of important work at home
Yes, only office work counts as real work
No, but homemaker work is not important

questions.explanation_correct: Anita is not correct. Homemakers do a lot of important work — cooking, cleaning, taking care of children, managing the house, and much more. Their work is very valuable and keeps the family running.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Homemakers work very hard every day. They cook, clean, wash, take care of children, and manage the entire household. This is very important work even though they do not go to an office. All work is valuable.

questions.question_text: Which of these shows dignity of labour?

options.text: Looking down on a sweeper because of their job
Thanking the school guard for keeping everyone safe
Thinking that only doctors are important

questions.explanation_correct: Thanking the school guard shows dignity of labour. It shows that you value and respect the guard's important work of keeping everyone safe. This is how we should treat all workers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Looking down on someone, ignoring them, or thinking only some jobs matter does not show dignity of labour. Thanking the guard for their work shows that you respect their job and value their service.

questions.question_text: What is the main occupation of people in villages?
questions.explanation_correct: The main occupation of people in villages is farming. Most villages in India are surrounded by fields where farmers grow rice, wheat, vegetables, and other crops.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Big offices, factories, and computer programming are more common in cities. In villages, the main occupation is farming. Farmers grow food crops in the fields around their villages.

questions.question_text: Which of these is found more in cities than in villages?
questions.explanation_correct: Tall buildings and heavy traffic are found more in cities. Cities have many buildings, offices, roads with lots of vehicles, shopping malls, and markets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Open fields, ponds, wells, and bullock carts are more common in villages. Cities are known for tall buildings, heavy traffic, large markets, offices, and many vehicles on the roads.

questions.question_text: Raman lives in a place with wide open fields, a river nearby, and people mostly do farming. Where does Raman most likely live?
questions.explanation_correct: Raman most likely lives in a village. Villages have wide open fields, rivers, ponds, and people mainly do farming. Cities have tall buildings, offices, and less open space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wide open fields, a nearby river, and farming are features of village life. Cities have tall buildings and busy roads instead. Raman's description matches a village, not a city, factory, or mall.

questions.question_text: Sneha moved from a village to a city. What new things might she see?

options.text: Tall buildings, malls, and lots of traffic

questions.explanation_correct: In a city, Sneha would see tall buildings, shopping malls, lots of traffic, offices, and many people. Cities are busier and more crowded than villages.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farms, bullock carts, and wells are common in villages, not cities. When moving to a city, Sneha would see tall buildings, malls, heavy traffic, and many more vehicles and people.

questions.question_text: Which statement correctly compares village and city life?

options.text: Villages have more traffic than cities
Cities have more open fields than villages
Villages have more open spaces and cities have more buildings
Both have exactly the same features

questions.explanation_correct: Villages have more open spaces, fields, and natural areas, while cities have more buildings, roads, and traffic. Both are important parts of India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Villages have more open spaces, fields, and greenery. Cities have more buildings, offices, roads, and traffic. They are different from each other, but both are important for the country.

questions.question_text: A person who keeps us safe and catches thieves is a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A policeman (or police officer) keeps us safe and catches thieves. The police maintain law and order and help people during emergencies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A postman delivers letters, a farmer grows food, and a carpenter makes furniture. The person who keeps us safe and catches thieves is a policeman or police officer.

questions.question_text: What would happen if there were no teachers?

options.text: Children would learn better by themselves
Children would not get education and knowledge

questions.explanation_correct: Without teachers, children would not get proper education and knowledge. Teachers play a crucial role in helping children learn, understand new things, and develop good values.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Teachers are essential for children's education. Without them, children would not learn to read, write, do maths, or understand science. Teachers guide children and help them grow into knowledgeable, responsible people.

questions.question_text: Kavita's uncle makes beautiful clay pots and diyas. He is a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Kavita's uncle is a potter. A potter uses clay to make pots, diyas (oil lamps), vases, and other items. Pottery is a beautiful and traditional craft in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A blacksmith works with iron, a goldsmith works with gold, and a painter uses colours. A person who makes things from clay, like pots and diyas, is called a potter.

questions.question_text: Gandhiji believed in the dignity of labour. He used to clean his own toilet and spin cotton. What message does this give?

options.text: Only Gandhiji should do all the work
No work is below anyone's dignity

questions.explanation_correct: Gandhiji's actions teach us that no work is below anyone's dignity. By cleaning his own toilet and spinning cotton, he showed that every type of work is respectable and valuable.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gandhiji was a great leader, yet he did cleaning and spinning himself. This teaches us that no work is below anyone's dignity. Even the simplest tasks have value, and we should not look down on any type of work.

questions.question_text: Many people in Aarav's village are farmers. They grow rice and send it to the city. This shows that _____.

options.text: Villages and cities do not need each other

questions.explanation_correct: This shows that villages provide food to cities. Farmers in villages grow crops like rice, wheat, and vegetables and send them to markets in cities. Villages and cities depend on each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cities do not have large farms to grow food. Villages grow food and send it to cities. This means villages and cities depend on each other — villages provide food and cities provide goods and services.

questions.question_text: A person who cuts hair is called a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A person who cuts hair is called a barber. Barbers use scissors, combs, and razors to cut and style hair. They work in barber shops or salons.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cobbler repairs shoes, a tailor stitches clothes, and a carpenter makes furniture. A person who cuts hair is called a barber.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an advantage of village life?
questions.explanation_correct: Fresh air and open spaces are advantages of village life. Villages have fields, trees, and less pollution, which means the air is cleaner and there is more space to move around.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Heavy traffic, air pollution, and crowded streets are problems of city life, not village life. Villages have the advantage of fresh air, open spaces, greenery, and a peaceful environment.

questions.question_text: A firefighter helps the community by _____.

options.text: Putting out fires and saving lives

questions.explanation_correct: A firefighter helps the community by putting out fires and saving lives. When there is a fire, firefighters rush to the spot with their fire engines and hoses to stop the fire and rescue people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Teaching is done by teachers, growing crops by farmers, and stitching by tailors. Firefighters are brave community helpers who put out fires, rescue people from burning buildings, and save lives.

questions.question_text: On the way to school, Divya sees a sweeper cleaning the road early in the morning. What should Divya do?

options.text: Smile and greet the sweeper with respect
Tell the sweeper to stop working

questions.explanation_correct: Divya should smile and greet the sweeper with respect. The sweeper is working hard early in the morning to keep the road clean for everyone. Respecting all workers is very important.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ignoring or making fun of any worker is wrong. The sweeper is doing very important work by keeping the streets clean. Divya should greet the sweeper with a smile and show respect for their hard work.

questions.question_text: A doctor uses a stethoscope to check patients.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A doctor uses a stethoscope to listen to a patient's heartbeat and breathing. It is one of the most important tools a doctor uses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Doctors do use stethoscopes to check patients. A stethoscope helps the doctor listen to the heartbeat, breathing, and other body sounds. This statement is true.

questions.question_text: Only big jobs like being a doctor or engineer deserve respect.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Every job deserves respect, not just big jobs. A sweeper, farmer, guard, or helper works just as hard and their work is equally important for the community.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All jobs deserve respect, not just being a doctor or engineer. A farmer who grows food, a sweeper who keeps streets clean, and a guard who keeps us safe all do important work. This is dignity of labour.

questions.question_text: Farming is the main occupation in most Indian villages.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Farming is the main occupation in most Indian villages. Farmers in villages grow crops like rice, wheat, sugarcane, and vegetables that feed the entire country.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Most people in Indian villages work as farmers. They grow food crops that are sent to cities and towns. Farming is indeed the main occupation in rural India. This statement is true.

questions.question_text: If there were no sanitation workers, our streets and neighbourhoods would become very dirty.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Sanitation workers keep our streets, neighbourhoods, and public places clean. Without them, garbage would pile up and our surroundings would become unhealthy and dirty.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sanitation workers play a vital role in keeping our environment clean. Without them, garbage would pile up, streets would be dirty, and diseases could spread. Their work is very important.

questions.question_text: We should say 'thank you' to people who help us, like the school guard or the bus driver.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. We should always say thank you to people who help us. Thanking the school guard, bus driver, or any helper shows respect and makes them feel valued.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Saying thank you to helpers like guards, drivers, and cleaners is a sign of good manners and respect. It shows that we value their hard work and care about them. This statement is true.

questions.question_text: A person who teaches children in school is called a _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A person who teaches children in school is called a teacher. Teachers help children learn new things, develop skills, and become knowledgeable and responsible.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is teacher. Teachers work in schools and help children learn subjects like maths, science, English, and many other things. They are very important community helpers.

questions.question_text: A _____ grows crops like rice and wheat in the fields.
questions.explanation_correct: A farmer grows crops like rice, wheat, vegetables, and fruits in the fields. Farmers are among the hardest-working people and provide food for the entire country.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is farmer. Farmers work in the fields to grow the food we eat. Without farmers, we would not have rice, wheat, dal, vegetables, or fruits.

questions.question_text: The belief that all work is important and every worker deserves respect is called dignity of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The belief that all work is important and every worker deserves respect is called dignity of labour. No job is big or small — every worker contributes to society.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is labour. Dignity of labour means respecting every type of work and every worker. Whether someone cleans, cooks, teaches, or heals — their work has dignity and value.

questions.question_text: In cities, there are tall buildings and more traffic, while in _____ there are open fields and farms.
questions.explanation_correct: In villages, there are open fields, farms, ponds, and more greenery. Villages are quieter and more peaceful compared to busy cities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is villages. Villages have open fields, farms, trees, and a peaceful environment. Cities have tall buildings, offices, shopping areas, and heavy traffic.

questions.question_text: People who help us in our daily life are called _____ helpers.
questions.explanation_correct: People who help us in our daily life are called community helpers. Doctors, teachers, police, firefighters, postmen, and sanitation workers are all community helpers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is community. Community helpers are people like doctors, teachers, police, postmen, and firefighters who help us every day and make our lives better.

questions.question_text: Which worker would you call if water pipes in your house burst?
questions.explanation_correct: You would call a plumber if water pipes burst. A plumber fixes water pipes, taps, and drainage systems. They are important workers who help us when there are water-related problems.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A carpenter works with wood, an electrician fixes electrical problems, and a painter paints walls. A plumber is the correct person to call for burst water pipes — they fix pipes, taps, and drains.

questions.question_text: Which pair of workers directly helps keep us healthy?
questions.explanation_correct: Doctors treat sick people and keep us healthy. Sanitation workers clean our surroundings which prevents diseases. Together, they directly help keep us healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While all workers are important, doctors and sanitation workers directly help keep us healthy. Doctors treat illnesses, and sanitation workers prevent diseases by keeping our environment clean.

questions.question_text: City life is always better than village life.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Neither city life nor village life is always better. Both have advantages. Villages have fresh air, open spaces, and peace. Cities have better hospitals, schools, and more job opportunities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both village and city life have their own advantages. Villages offer fresh air, peace, and open spaces. Cities offer more services, schools, and job options. Neither is always better than the other.

questions.question_text: Which of the following workers does NOT use fire or heat as part of their regular work?
questions.explanation_correct: A postman delivers letters and does not use fire or heat in their work. A chef uses fire to cook food, a blacksmith uses fire to shape iron, and a potter uses fire to bake clay pots.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chefs use fire to cook, blacksmiths heat iron in fire, and potters bake their clay pots in kilns (ovens). A postman delivers letters and parcels — this job does not involve fire or heat.

questions.question_text: Neha's class is making 'Thank You' cards for school helpers — the gardener, cleaner, and guard. This activity teaches children about _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Making thank-you cards for school helpers teaches children to respect all workers, which is the value of dignity of labour. It shows that gardeners, cleaners, and guards do important work and deserve appreciation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This activity is not about drawing or writing exams. It teaches children an important value — respecting all workers. When children thank the gardener, cleaner, and guard, they learn that every job is important.

questions.question_text: During heavy rain, the road near Amit's school gets flooded. Which community helpers would come to rescue people?
questions.explanation_correct: Police and firefighters would come to rescue people during floods. These community helpers are trained to handle emergencies and save lives during natural disasters.
questions.explanation_incorrect: During emergencies like floods, police and firefighters are the community helpers who come to rescue people. They are specially trained to handle dangerous situations and save lives.

questions.question_text: Cities have more _____ and traffic, while villages have more open spaces.
questions.explanation_correct: Cities have more buildings and traffic, while villages have more open spaces, fields, and greenery. Both types of places are important parts of India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is buildings. Cities are known for their many buildings — houses, offices, hospitals, malls, and schools. Villages have more open land, fields, and natural spaces.

questions.question_text: An electrician helps by _____.

options.text: Fixing electrical wires, switches, and lights

questions.explanation_correct: An electrician fixes electrical wires, switches, lights, and fans. When there is a problem with electricity at home or school, we call an electrician to fix it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Growing vegetables is a farmer's job, cutting hair is a barber's job, and making pots is a potter's job. An electrician's job is to fix electrical problems — wires, switches, lights, and other electrical equipment.
